page.title: 03Kingsley Church
page.content: The parish church of Kingsley is St.Werburgh's. The tower is the oldest part of the church built in the 1200's. The nave was rebuilt in 1821 and the chancel in 1886. The Reverend T V Edwards is the rector and has served the parish since 1972. On Sunday there are three Services: Said Communion at 8.0 am, Sung Eucharist, with Sunday School, at 10.45 am and Evensong at 6.0 pm in Summer, 4.0 pm in Winter. There are on average 70 Communicants on Sunday. During the year there are about 15 baptisms, 18 weddings and 36 funerals. There is a mixed choir of 29 with Mrs E Sales as organist. The church has 6 bells and a team of bellringers. There is a Methodist Church in Hazles Cross Road, Kingsley and one in Churnet Valley Road, Kingsley Holt. The Methodist Minister is the Rev Hubble.
